titles.title: Dietary Supplement Tax Fairness Act of 2007
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide that amounts paid for foods for special dietary use, dietary supplements, or medical foods shall be treated as medical expenses.
Dietary Supplement Tax Fairness Act of 2007

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: Dietary Supplement Tax Fairness Act of 2007 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to treat amounts paid for foods for special dietary use, dietary supplements, and medical foods as medical expenses for purposes of the medical expense tax deduction.
